history.text: What were your thoughts on this movie? Did you enjoy it/
I'm not a big fan of war movies, so I've never actually seen it to be honest. What's your opinion?
Well, when I watched it, I actually fell asleep halfway. I'm really not into war movies either but I gave it a shot. It had very little dialogue which made it very confusing to understand.
the movie kept directing it back and forth to different scenes which made it so hard to follow

Yeah, from what I've read in the  introduction, it appears they didn't use much sound.  I can somewhat understand the reasoning, but don't think it would make it much more interesting or easy to follow.
I think the actors look decent in it though.
Honestly, one of the reasons I decided to watch it was because Harry Styles was in it. But the acting was also done horribly. I'm not sure how it got 92% on rotten tomatoes
I might have to give it another try
I see that Rotten Tomatoes gave it that, but I don't trust them at all.
Really? I usually trust rotten tomatoes
I think everyone has their own tastes and preferences, so putting stock into someone else's views is meaningless to me.  The fact they gave it 92, means I probably wouldn't like it.
So it's based on an ambush in WW2? Is that correct?

yeah it'
s about a German ambush
So the main character is Tommy, who is the only survivor?
No I believe there were three survivors
Tommy, Alex, and Gibson
Gibson saves TOmmy adn Alex
I see that. So he found the other 2 people then after surviving the ambush?
It says they hide inside a trawler. What is that anyway?
a trawler is like a fishing boat
I'm not really sure about your first question
So then they end up getting into an argument while trying to hide out?
yeah, I believe so. But there is a very interesting scene in this movie which I will tell you about
Sounds like there is plenty of action on the sea after they get on the boat.
So their ship was about to sink because of all the holes and they ended up at a point where they had to throw people out of the boat to make it lighter
All the members in the boat actually ganged up on one person to sacrifice their life for the others
which I thought was very intense
So 300,000 people get evacuated? That's a lot of people. I guess that's good they were saved.
yeah but I thought it was horrifying for that one person who had to jump out
but overall I think the director of the movie wanted to show heroism
Yeah that seems insane. At least they got some kind of commendation.
It says they cross the English channel.  I wonder how far that was.
The hero in the movie was George because since he ended up saving so many men. So the ending did a good job by showing his heroism by having a front page article about him
I believe the English Channel is about 5000 miles
At least they made the paper too I suppose.
Would you watch this film if you got the chance?
I think I would. It seems semi interesting

uid1response.feedback: That was a very odd HIT, and I apologize if I did anything wrong, but I tried my best to follow the instructions.
